messages.message: It seems like the Converse app will sometimes output its own internal queries instead of the answer to my question? (if I’m interpreting this right)

So the inner working on this app currently is that it doesn't carry a conversation, it's mainly a Q&A -- each chat is evaluated independently. So what happened I think is it treats your "it's 2023" as an independent question (and it doesn't know what this question is asking), so it replies some random thing or guess what you're trying to ask

yeah I had gathered that the chat is not context-aware; I guess I was expecting something like “There is no information in the given text to answer this question.“, which is what it usually says when I ask it something it can’t answer
i think our prompt in this case trying to guess what you want to ask :stuck_out_tongue:
Since your prompt isn't a question the model tries to ask a question itself and then answer it. This is expected from our current prompts.
@vineeth Let’s brainstorm on this a bit today!
